ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: In general, would you say your health is:
Notes: 1= Excellent; 2= Very Good; 3= Good; 4= Fair; 5= Poor ; 888=Don't Know/not sure; -999=Missing

ElementDescription: At the present time, would you say your eyesight using both eyes (with glasses or contact lenses, if you wear them) is:
Notes: 1 = Excellent ; 2 = Good ; 3 = Fair ; 4 = Poor ; 5 = Very poor ; 6 = Completely blind

ElementDescription: Do you currently wear contact lenses?
Notes: 1 = Yes ; 0 = No

ElementDescription: Have you ever worn contact lenses?
Notes: 1 = Yes ; 0 = No

ElementDescription: Are you considering wearing contact lenses in the next year?
Notes: 1 = Yes ; 0 = No

ElementDescription: What type of contact lenses do you wear?
Notes: 1 = Soft ; 2 = Hard ; 3 = Gas permeable ; 8 = Don't know

ElementDescription: Do you sleep with your contact lenses in?
Notes: 0 = No ; 2 = Sometimes ; 3 = Usually

ElementDescription: How much difficulty do you have driving at night? Would you say you have:
Notes: 1 =No difficulty at all ; 2 = A little difficulty ; 3 = Moderate difficulty ; 4 = Extreme difficulty ; 5 = Stopped doing this because of your eyesight ; 6 = Stopped doing this for other reasons, or not interested in doing this

ElementDescription: How much difficulty do you have driving in difficult conditions, such as in bad weather, during rush hour, on the freeway, or in city traffic? Would you say you have:
Notes: 1 =No difficulty at all ; 2 = A little difficulty ; 3 = Moderate difficulty ; 4 = Extreme difficulty ; 5 = Stopped doing this because of your eyesight ; 6 = Stopped doing this for other reasons, or not interested in doing this

ElementDescription: Have you ever had a crossed or wandering eye (amblyopia)?
Notes: 1 = Yes ; 0 = No ; 8 = Don't know

ElementDescription: Have you ever had double vision?
Notes: 1 = Yes ; 0 = No ; 8 = Don't know

ElementDescription: Do you ever tilt your head when looking straight?
Notes: 1 = Yes ; 0 = No ; 8 = Don't know

ElementDescription: Have you ever undergone eye muscle surgery?
Notes: 1 = Yes ; 0 = No ; 8 = Don't know

ElementDescription: Have you ever worn a patch or used eye drops (atropine penalization) for eye correction?
Notes: 1 = Yes ; 0 = No ; 8 = Don't know

ElementDescription: Have you ever worn glasses or contacts?
Notes: 1 = Yes ; 0 = No ; 8 = Don't know

ElementDescription: You answered YES or DON'T KNOW to some of the questions above (having a crossed/wandering eye, double vision, tilting head to look straight, eye muscle surgery, using a patch or eye drops for eye correction, wearing glasses or contacts). Please provide further details (i.e. age of onset of eye condition, dates of surgery, name of procedure if known, etc.):
Do you have a coloboma (absence or defect of ocular tissue ranging from a small pit in the optic disk to extensive defects in the iris, ciliary body, choroid, retina, or optic disk)?
Notes: 1 = Yes ; 0 = No ; 8 = Don't know

ElementDescription: Do you have microphthalmia (abnormally small eye)?
Notes: 1 = Yes ; 0 = No ; 8 = Don't know

ElementDescription: Do you have epibulbar dermoids (eye tumors that are not recurrent or progressive)?
Notes: 1 = Yes ; 0 = No ; 8 = Don't know

ElementDescription: Do you have any abnormal ocular features (e.g., epicanthal folds-tissue overlapping the nasal corner of the eye, telecanthus- increased distance between the inner corners of the eyes, slanting of the palpebral fissure(s)-opening for the eyes between the eyelids)?
Notes: 1 = Yes ; 0 = No ; 8 = Don't know

ElementDescription: Do you have any retinal defects (retinal tears, detachments, etc.)?
Notes: 1 = Yes ; 0 = No ; 8 = Don't know

ElementDescription: Do you have any visual impairment other than previously noted?
Notes: 1 = Yes ; 0 = No ; 8 = Don't know

ElementDescription: You answered YES or DON'T KNOW to some of the questions above (having a coloboma, microphthalmia, epibulbar dermoids,  abnormal ocular features, retinal defects, or other visual impairments). Please describe:

How much of the time do you worry about your eyesight?
Notes: 1 = None of the time; 2 = A little of the time; 3 = Some of the time; 4 = Most of the time; 5 = All of the time

ElementDescription: How much pain or discomfort have you had in and around your eyes (for example, burning, itching, or aching)? Would you say it is:
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Mild; 3 = Moderate; 4 = Severe; 5 = Very severe

ElementDescription: How much difficulty do you have reading ordinary print in newspapers? Would you say you have:
Notes: 1 =No difficulty at all ; 2 = A little difficulty ; 3 = Moderate difficulty ; 4 = Extreme difficulty ; 5 = Stopped doing this because of your eyesight ; 6 = Stopped doing this for other reasons, or not interested in doing this

ElementDescription: Are you limited in how long you can work or do other activities because of your vision?

ElementDescription: I stay home most of the time because of my eyesight
Notes: 1 = Definitely true; 2 = Mostly true; 3 = Not sure; 4 = Mostly false; 5 = Defnitely false

ElementDescription: How would you rate your overall health, on a scale where zero is as bad as death and 10 is best possible health?
Notes: 0 = Worst; 10 = Best

ElementDescription: How would you rate your eyesight now (with glasses or contact lens on, if you wear them), on a scale of from 0 to 10, where zero means the worst possible eyesight, as bad or worse than being blind, and 10 means the best possible eyesight?
Notes: 0 = Worst; 10 = Best

ElementDescription: Wearing glasses, how much difficulty do you have reading the small print in a telephone book, on a medicine bottle, or on legal forms? Would you say:
